cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SE of Fort Lauderdale, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest tonight, expected to parallel the east coast of Florida Sunday, then turn north-northwest/north and accelerate toward coastal GA/SC and the Mid-Atlantic early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: somewhere along the SC or southern NC coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Boca Raton to Volusia/Flagler County Line FL; Tropical Storm Warning north of Ocean Reef to Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas and the Atlantic coast from South Florida northward to New England through mid-week
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast 1–2 inches on the west-central FL coast)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (surge threat confined to Atlantic side of FL)
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of gusty winds 25–35 mph possible in rain bands Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Tampa Bay side
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of intermittent tropical downpours possible Sunday–early Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional lightning in squalls; choppy bay/near-shore seas could hamper small-craft movements
